thread.title: Lady Cougars fall short at South Forsyth
thread.title_full: Lady Cougars fall short at South Forsyth

title: Lady Cougars fall short at South Forsyth
text:
Lady Cougars fall short at South Forsyth Thursday, October 22, 2015 
CUMMING-Newnan's hopes of advancing to the Class Elite Eight next week in Columbus ended on the road Wednesday night when South Forsyth swept the Lady Cougars 10-4 and 13-1. 
South Forsyth never trailed in either game out hitting the Lady Cougars 25-11. 
Newnan sophomore Addie Andrews took the loss in both games, combining four strikeouts in the doubleheader. 
South Forsyth pitcher Katherine Huey picked up the wins for the Lady War Eagles in both games, striking out 14, including 10 in the first contest. She also allowed just two hits in the second game. 
Both teams used the long ball for offense. 
After Newnan fell behind 7-0 in the first contest, it rallied with three runs in the top of the sixth, including a tworun homer by Leslie Davis. 
Maysen Willard added an RBI in the Lady Cougars' rally. 
However, the Lady War Eagles added three more run in the bottom of the sixth. 
Newnan scored one more run in the seventh, but it wasn't enough. 
South Forsyth only led 3-0 after three innings, but exploded for four runs in the bottom of the fifth. 
Huey helped her own cause with a two-run homer in the inning. 
The Lady War Eagles the put second game out of reach early with a five-run first inning. 
South Forsyth hit five home runs in the game, including two from Binaca Mora. Sophia Tapla, Jordin Englar and Lauren Baccari also hit home runs and help end the contest in the fourth inning by the mercy rule. 
Newnan center fielder Hannah Scarbrough had a solo home run in the third inning of the second game for the Lady Cougars' only run. 
Scarbrough also went 3-for-3 in the first game. 
Senior first baseman Maysen Willard had three hits in the doubleheader including a 2-for-4 performance in the first game after reaching with a double and a triple. Shakekerra Geter, Darby Keene and Paige Depol each had base hits in the first game for the Cougars. 
Game 1 
LADY WAR EAGLES 10, LADY COUGARS 4
